comments:
There is new breakage somewhere with plugin-provided JSF libs. This is possibly as a result of the recent refactoring effort (bit of a guess, but timeframe seems to fit and I don't think we've been doing much with this code recently). To see one manifestation of the issue, create a new Dynamic Web Project and on first page of wizard select the "JavaServer Faces v1.1 Project" Configuration. Immediately an error is seen. This error can be hit in other ways also, essentially anytime an attempt is made to manipulate JSF library references when any plugin-provided JSF libraries exist.

Top of stacktrace for selecting "Configuration" case follows.

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.ui.internal.jsflibraryconfig.JSFLibraryConfigControl$2.selectionChanged(JSFLibraryConfigControl.java:275)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.Viewer$2.run(Viewer.java:162)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:843)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.JFaceUtil$1.run(JFaceUtil.java:44)
at org.eclipse.jface.util.SafeRunnable.run(SafeRunnable.java:149)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.Viewer.fireSelectionChanged(Viewer.java:160)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.updateSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1976)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.setSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1577)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.ui.internal.jsflibraryconfig.JSFLibraryConfigControl.initializeControlValues(JSFLibraryConfigControl.java:180)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.ui.internal.jsflibraryconfig.JSFLibraryConfigControl.loadControlValuesFromModel(JSFLibraryConfigControl.java:119)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.ui.internal.project.facet.JSFFacetInstallPage.initJSFCfgCtrlValues(JSFFacetInstallPage.java:262)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.ui.internal.project.facet.JSFFacetInstallPage.initializeValues(JSFFacetInstallPage.java:219)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.ui.internal.project.facet.JSFFacetInstallPage.restoreDefaultSettings(JSFFacetInstallPage.java:464)
